page.title: 01Farming around Longdon
page.content:
About half the area is used as{rough {grazing}or{permanent pasture}for{ beef {cattle }and {sheep.}There is one{dairy farm, a{pig}farm and a{poultry} farm. The farmers make hay once a year. On the remaining land {cereal crops are grown and there are the occasional fields of{peas}and nowadays{rape-seed.
Since{Longdon Marsh}has been drained the area is cropped in summer, though it always floods in winter when the Severn is high. The land usage has changed over the last twenty years from predominantly rough grazing to more arable farming. This has led to a decrease in the {wild-life. }The otters which once lived on Longdon Marsh have now disappeared to the disappointment of the local residents. { {.
